intro: Corymbia dimorpha, commonly known as the red gum, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its smooth, reddish-barked trunk and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. It is well adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and resilient species. Corymbia dimorpha is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in various soil types.
